text.title: Crowdfund a Concert
text.head: Crowdfund a Concert
text.p: This article explains how a musician , a band or their teams can launch and run a crowdfunding campaign for a concert , show or a gig .
text.head: Steps

list.item: Plan your program . Decide on your tracklist , host , supporting acts , any additional entertainment , like quests or contests .

Calculate your budget . Consider what costs an event you are planning is going to include :
venue
artist and host fees
equipment rentals
staffing the event
transportation and accommodation costs
stage decor
Select the crowdfunding platform . You can go with a general-purpose crowdfunding platform ( Kickstarter , Indiegogo ) or a concert-specific platform ( Show4me ) .

Produce promotional materials . Prepare an exciting , engaging description of your event , promotional images , posters , flyers , images for social media . A promo video can be a great way to make your campaign much more enticing for potential concertgoers , as well as existing fans .

Fill out the campaign page and launch . Enter all the information about your campaign : the title of your show , prospective date and venue ( subject to change ) , description , upload video and photos . On concert-specific platforms for crowdfunding you can list event sponsors or any age restrictions . Set ticket types and prices and launch your campaign .

Promote your campaign . Announce your launch on all your best social media , let your fans and friends know , put up posters close to your prospective location and/or handout flyers , run ads if you have the budget to .

Set your date and distribute tickets . Once your minimum funding budget is met , you can contact and book the venue and set your performance date . If you are using a general-purpose crowdfunding platform , you 'll have to take care of ticket design , production and distribution . If you are using a concert-specific crowdfunding platform , the tickets will be generated and delivered to attendees ' inboxes automatically . Withdraw funds to finance your production .
Hold your event . Complete the preparations for your show and host the event !

Thank contributors . With all the effort you 've put into promoting your show and getting all the contributions , you would n't want that to go to waste . Keep your supporters engaged with your music , art and career by running a fan hub on a social media platform or continue interacting with your backers on the crowdfunding platform , as some offer the social network-like features , making it easier to crowdfund your next event .

text.head: Tips

list.item: Make sure your campaign description is exciting and you know exactly the audience you want to attend your event . The more your description appeals to your target audience , the better are your chances of getting the campaign fully funded .
If you want your tickets to be sent out to your backers automatically , go with a concert-specific crowdfunding platform .

text.head: Warnings

list.item: The success of your campaign is contingent on your promotional efforts . The bigger the budget , the more promotional effort your campaign will require .
